content:
What do people think of changing the default dark theme to Ayu? Personally, I feel it's more readable than the "Dark" theme.

I have Ayu set as my dark theme on doc.rust-lang.org and docs.rs, but whenever I build docs locally (for my projects or for rustdoc changes), I'm annoyed to have to change it. And it'll become extra annoying once the PR getting rid of the paintbrush icon is removed.

Of course, some people may prefer the Dark theme over Ayu—which would just invert this annoyance—but I'm wondering at least how you all would feel about changing the default.
I think we need a browser add-on that allows you to just set rustdoc themes once and have it apply everywhere.

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/rustdoc-global-theme/ looks like it does it (I downloaded the XPI and peeked at the scripts; it doesn't have a GitHub page, but the source code is perfectly readable).

I like Ayu a lot better than Dark. But I don't use Dark mode as my primary so I'm not as involved. Also strong agree that we should have a browser plugin that sets your rustdoc themes across all places.

Note: We could actually achieve the same effect without a browser extension by having all rustdoc-generated HTML query doc.rust-lang.org for your preferences there. We'd have to do some Access-Control-Allow-Origin magic on docs.rust-lang.org, but it's doable. Folks might object to the off-domain request though.
Also I've been thinking I want to make a Solarized Light / Solarized Dark pair of themes. https://ethanschoonover.com/solarized/
I might just fork that add-on to add the rest of the rustdoc settings, since it only does themes, but settings.html has a lot of other stuff in it.
I'm against changing the default dark theme. Also I didn't know about the add-ons, nice!
@GuillaumeGomez just so we're on the same page, could you explain why you're against changing the default dark theme?
My answer is more like: why would we change it?
Because (IMO) Ayu is better, mainly because it's higher contrast.
this seems like a good source about color combinations and contrast for readability, for people with and without dyslexia: https://www.w3.org/WAI/RD/2012/text-customization/r11

One specific critique I have for the dark theme, based purely on personal taste: The orange link color is really bright, and draws too much attention to links and headings.

image.png
We can change that. I wrote the dark theme in something like 2015 when I was muuuch younger. If you have improvements in mind, please add them :)

@Noah Lev Just to be more explicit on my position: I'm not 100% opposite to changing the default dark theme. It's a big part of me trying to impose my favourite one. If there are strong arguments supporting your position, then let's change it. Just that they need to be really strong ones haha
Yeah, I think increasing contrast between text and background, while making links stand out less, would help a lot.
